intro: Opsiandra maya, commonly known as the Maya opsiandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
